meanings.definition: An increase in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The scaleup of the cake made it perfect for sharing at the party.
meanings.sent2: The scaleup of the city's population led to increased traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The scaleup of the balloon made it float away faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The scaleup of the project's scope brought new challenges to the team.
meanings.sent5: The scaleup of the wave was so massive that surfers had to be cautious.

meanings.definition: To increase in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: She decided to scaleup the font size on her computer for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to scaleup production to meet the growing demand.
meanings.sent3: As the garden scaleupped with more plants, it became a beautiful oasis.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's performance scaleupped significantly after intense training.
meanings.sent5: The excitement scaleupped as the concert date approached.

meanings.definition: A company that is rapidly growing in size and revenue.
meanings.sent1: The tech scaleup attracted investors with its innovative products.
meanings.sent2: Investors are keeping an eye on the scaleup for potential opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The scaleup's success story inspired other entrepreneurs to dream big.
meanings.sent4: Joining a scaleup can be a thrilling experience with endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The scaleup's expansion into new markets brought exciting challenges.
